posts.author: Koski
posts.content:
I'm mostly interested in being able to play the OCs (playing co-op with friends), some custom modules with hopefully normal power level.

I know summoning in general is not too viable, but should be doable with some backup spells as a Wizard.

My idea is around human, wizard, maybe specialized in conjuration (though I'm a bit puzzled if its worth it for the style, as transmutation contains such good spells).

Is there any even relatively viable wizard summoner builds? Preferably with no more than 2 classes in it. By viable I don't mean super characters like Scythe WM hitting 300s~ etc. But as epic summoner PC as possible.

posts.author: Devlinor
posts.content:
While I am not posting one of my builds here on this subject, yet, I do have a suggestion. Wizzys are good, but a better summoner for solo or party play would be a cleric with the animal domain. This would give you one step up in your summons. The best summoning build that I can think of is Grizzled Dwarflords, The Fighting Ariel of Elohanna As long as you have the ability to choose the animal domain and the plant domain, this build will rock. Will try to come up with an original (at least one of my own, original is a misnomer since most things have been done before) at some point.

Dev

posts.author: Demos
posts.content:
You can have your cake and eat it too...

Try a Wizard 39 / Cleric 1 and take Animal as one of your domains or Wizard 39 / Druid 1. You can keep your WIS score at 8 (if you like) and take Cleric/Druid at any level beside 1.
